com.tsgrp.migration.connect

Class SimpleConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tsgrp.migration.connect.AbstractConnector
      • com.tsgrp.migration.connect.SimpleConnector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Connector

    public class SimpleConnector
extends AbstractConnector
    This simple connector, by default, returns a new empty SimpleConnection with each call to #newConnection(); but if a "singleton" Connection is injected, that instance is returned each time. In any case, disconnect(Connection) is a no-op.

      • obtainConnection

        public Connection obtainConnection()
        If singletonConnection is set, return it; otherwise just return an empty SimpleConnection every time.

        concrete Connection

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect(Connection connection)
        Description copied from interface: Connector
        Release any resources associated with the given Connection and "free it". It is the responsiblity of the Connector, not the Connection, to allocate and release resources.
